holidays.name: International Plastic Bag Free Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to encouraging people worldwide to reduce plastic bag use and protect the environment by opting for reusable bags.
holidays.origin: Started by environmental activists to raise awareness about plastic pollution and its impact on oceans and wildlife.
holidays.funFact: If everyone used just one less plastic bag a week, it would save billions of bags annually worldwide!

holidays.name: Stay Out of the Sun Day
holidays.description: An unusual observance encouraging people to take a break from the scorching summer sun and find some shade or indoor activities.
holidays.origin: Coined by health advocates to remind people to avoid sun overexposure and reduce the risk of sunburns and skin cancer.
holidays.funFact: July is typically one of the hottest months, making this an odd yet timely holiday to chill and protect your skin!

holidays.name: Compliment Your Mirror Day
holidays.description: A quirky self-love celebration where you give your reflection some kind words and positive affirmations.
holidays.origin: An internet-born daily reminder to boost self-esteem and body positivity by appreciating oneself.
holidays.funFact: Talking kindly to your reflection can improve mood and increase self-confidence over time!

holidays.name: Stay Away from Seattle Day
holidays.description: A tongue-in-cheek unofficial holiday where people joke about avoiding the rainy and cloudy weather of Seattle.
holidays.origin: Pop culture and travel jokes about Seattle's famously gloomy climate inspired this lighthearted day.
holidays.funFact: Seattle actually rains less annually than cities like New York and Miami, but the gray days make it feel like it rains nonstop!
